description.narrative: By 2015, government and local community capacities to promote and sustain girls' and boys' rights to protection from violence, exploitation and abuse are strengthened in humanitarian and post-conflict settings

mailing-address.narrative: Gerief west [Manshiya] block # First District H Plots numbers 6/3

sector.narrative: Administrative data and Information Management System (IMS) including CPIMS+, GBVIMS+, MRMIMS+
Child Protection humanitarian AoR/humanitarian sector coordination
Children associated with armed forces and armed groups - prevention and response
Family reunification in emergencies - prevention and response
Landmines and explosive weapons - prevention and assistance
MRM - Child protection monitoring and reporting of grave violations in armed conflict (Security Council Resolutions 1612, 1882, 1888 and 1960)
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
Services to prevent or respond to gender-based violence in emergencies

title.narrative: Sudan United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Programmes in Sudan (Communication for Development)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2017 Sudan: Independent Gender Review of the Country Programme of Cooperation Sudan-UNICEF 2013-2017
Sudan 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Sudan Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2015, government and local community capacities to promote and sustain girls' and boys' rights to protection from violence, exploitation and abuse are strengthened in humanitarian and post-conflict settings
Benchmarks of UNICEF's Core committments for Children have been fully attained
